intro.description: With the Git Clone Wizard you can clone repositories using different transport protocols.

item.title: Start Clone Wizard
item.description: The clone wizard can be started from the "Import Projects from Git" wizard using "Import... > Git > Projects from Git > Next > Clone..." or from the "Git Repositories View" using the "Clone a Git Repository" toolbar button.

item.title: Repository Selection
item.description:
Enter the repository location.
If you already have a repository URI in your clipboard, i.e. copied from a gitweb, github, wiki or any other page, it will be automatically entered into the URI field. The other fields (i.e. Host, Repository path, Protocol, Port) will then be automatically filled.
In case cloning requires authentication (which is not the case for many repositories), enter your credentials into the User and Password fields.
For a complete description of all fields as well as the supported protocols, see the referenced documentation.

item.title: Branch Selection
item.description:
Choose branches to be cloned from the repository.
By default all available branches are checked.

item.title: Local Destination
item.description:
Define local storage settings.
Specify the destination directory of the cloned repository. If this directory does not yet exist, it will be created by the wizard.
Optionally, you can change the initial branch that will be created and checked out locally. The default remote name is 'origin'. This can also be changed if necessary.
Click Finish to end the wizard.
item.onCompletion: You have now successfully cloned a Git repository.
